text: Hey this is Henry from MinuteEarth.

Recently NBC & YouTube asked us to make a
video giving context for a question at the

democratic presidential debate on January
17th, 2016.

Actually, they asked us to make 2 videos because
debates are unpredictable live events and

they wanted to have back up in case one of
the candidates covered the topic of our video
before it was shown.

So without further ado, here, exclusively
on the internet, is the video that DIDN’T

get shown at the debate:
Hello from MinuteEarth - we’re scientists

and writers who explore how things work on
our planet.

In 1990, scientists warned the world of an
invisible threat: heat-trapping gases from

fossil fuels were building up in the air and
warming the planet.

Since then, record temperatures, rising seas,
stronger storms, and worsening droughts have

made the threat of climate change visible
and real.

So last month, delegates from 196 world governments
gathered in Paris and finally made a pact
to fight it.

For this pact to work, everyone must keep
their initial promises and also make stronger
commitments soon.

The U.S. has pledged to cut emissions by about
18% over the next decade, but our current

strategy gets us only a quarter of the way
there.

If we're going to keep the promise we made
in Paris, we’ll need an action plan with
more action.

So there you go – if you want to see the
video that DID make it into the debate, we’ve

linked to it in the video description – or
you can watch the whole debate at the NBC
News youtube channel.

And a huge thanks to our patreon supporters
who make projects like this possible – this

was a crazy last minute endeavor, and we had
to make two videos even though only one was
going be used!

We definitely couldn’t afford to do it without
your support.

So thank you – and if you’d like to support
MinuteEarth, you can do so at Patreon.com/minuteearth.
Thanks again for watching!
